Challenge: On any body of your choice, set up the lowest orbit possible. The orbit must be stable for 300 seconds after the submitted image.

For example, my attempt on Minmus (taken a regrettable few seconds after perihelion, where it was about 2/3 the height):
There's a Challenge Section for a reason, mate.

So is it the lowest periapsis that counts?

does it matter if I start by accelerating a craft to 2/3rds the speed of light and then sending it through the lower atmosphere of Laythe?

Okay. You are probably not gonna like it. But its not my fault that you let me do this. Periapsis of 1 meter, orbit makes no collision with Minmus until 17 hours later and there is plenty of fuel available to make course correction if needed.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I win. It is an orbit. It has a periapsis and an apoapsis.

Edited March 17, 2014 by Pds314
1m, lol, glad I didn't have to clean that suit afterwards.

inb4 the OP decides it's judged by the semi-major axis.

But yeah, unless the intention is to allow suborbital trajectories and orbits that may eventually hit terrain, the requirement should be revised to one complete orbit.
